item.title: Kristin add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "Destroying things is much easier than making them." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "You're still trying to protect me. Real or not real," he whispers. "Real," I answer. "Because that's what you and I do, protect each other." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "So it's you and a syringe against the Capitol? See, this is why no one lets you make the plans." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "It takes ten times as long to put yourself back together as it does to fall apart." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "What I need is the dandelion in the spring. The bright yellow that means rebirth instead of destruction. The promise that life can go on, no matter how bad our losses. That it can be good again." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I knew, you would do me good, in some way, at some time;- I saw it in your eyes when I first beheld you: their expression and smile did not- (again he stopped)- did not (he proceeded hastily) strike delight to my very inmost heart so for nothing. " -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "True love is not so much a matter of romance as it is a matter of anxious concern for the well-being of one's companion." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "And, when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it." -- Paulo Coelho
